intro: Bulbocodium serotinum, commonly known as the late-flowering bulbous bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It blooms in late summer to early autumn, making it a distinctive feature of the late season flora. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
